授業の概要・背景:
This course is designed to provide regularly enrolled students the unique opportunity to interact and learn with foreign
exchange students on a weekly basis, and vice versa. At the end of this course the students will have a deeper and more meaningful understanding of global cultural perspectives on various issues, both in Japan and from around the world. Foreign exchange students will also be able to gain firsthand insight into modern Japanese daily life and regularly enrolled KGU students will be able to learn about challenges and benefits of studying abroad directly from international exchange students currently studying abroad in Japan.
授業方法: All classes are conducted on campus, face-to-face. This is not a lecture-based course. Instead, this course is student centered and focuses on student-generated discussions based on personal cultural backgrounds and foreign cultural interests. The course will be taught entirely in English and students will be expected to use English for all class speaking and assignments. All students will be expected to engage in daily phatic conversation each lesson and actively contribute to building a comfortable and communicative class atmosphere.

トピック.授業計画1: This class is conducted entirely in English and students will be expected to ONLY speak English during class. Students will be expected to actively participate in lengthy interactive discussions with their classmates each week about self-chosen topics (natural real life free speaking) for the purpose of enhancing and strengthening communicative competence and confidence speaking casually in English about daily life interests and occurrences.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students will need to work together with group members (other students) on all 3 main assignments so there is a strong emphasis on group work where students will be relied on to complete a portion of a larger group project. Individual efforts will be assessed and rewarded but ability to work cooperatively with other students is a main part of your assignment assessment.
